docstr: `SIZE` — Determine the size of an array ### Description Determine the extent of `ARRAY` along a specified dimension `DIM`, or the total number of elements in `ARRAY` if `DIM` is absent. ### Syntax `RESULT = SIZE(ARRAY[, DIM [, KIND]])` ### Arguments | `ARRAY` | Shall be an array of any type. If `ARRAY` is a pointer it must be associated and allocatable arrays must be allocated. | `DIM` | (Optional) shall be a scalar of type `INTEGER`and its value shall be in the range from 1 to n, where n equals the rank of `ARRAY`. | `KIND` | (Optional) An `INTEGER` initialization expression indicating the kind parameter of the result. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER` and of kind `KIND`. If `KIND` is absent, the return value is of default integer kind. ### Example ``` PROGRAM test_size   WRITE(*,*) SIZE((/ 1, 2 /)) ! 2 END PROGRAM ``` ### Standard Fortran 95 and later, with `KIND` argument Fortran 2003 and later ### Class Inquiry function ### See also SHAPE, RESHAPE
